intro: Craspidospermum verticillatum, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Marchaliaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as gametangia, are prominently displayed on the leafy shoots. Craspidospermum verticillatum is a non-vascular plant that plays a role in nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
